main.quote: This book fills a much-needed gap.
main.speaker: Moses Hadas

main.quote: How can I lose to such an idiot?
main.speaker: Aaron Nimzovich

main.quote: He is one of those people...
main.speaker: H. H. Munro

main.quote: I can write better than anybody...
main.speaker: A. J. Liebling

main.quote: Anyone ... is, of course, in a state of sin.
main.speaker: John von Neumann

main.quote: If you haven't got anything ...next to me.
main.speaker: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

main.quote: The cynics are right nine times...
main.speaker: Henry Louis Mencken

main.quote: For centuries, theologians have been explaining the unknowable...
main.speaker: Henry Louis Mencken

main.quote: Every normal man must be tempted at times to ...begin slitting throats.
main.speaker: Henry Louis Mencken

main.quote: Show me a ... man and I will ...
main.speaker: Carl Gustav Jung

main.quote: Any man who is ...a conservative, has no brains.
main.speaker: Sir Winston Churchill

main.quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty... in every difficulty.
main.speaker: Sir Winston Churchill

main.quote: A friendship...is better than a business...
main.speaker: John D. Rockefeller

main.quote: You can only find truth with logic...
main.speaker: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

main.quote: I'm all in favor of keeping dangerous weapons...
main.speaker: Frank Lloyd Wright

main.quote: No one can earn a million dollars...
main.speaker: William Jennings Bryan

main.quote: ...the skeleton in your closet... teach it to dance.
main.speaker: George Bernard Shaw

main.quote: A consensus means that everyone agrees...
main.speaker: Abba Eban

main.quote: The secret of success is to know something...
main.speaker: Aristotle Onassis
